Alt + D: [Explorer] Select the address bar.
Alt + Enter: Display properties for the selected item; [Explorer] Open the Properties dialog box for the selected item.
Alt + Esc: Cycle through items in the order in which they were opened.
Alt + F4: Close the active item, or exit the active app.
Alt + F8: Show your password on the sign-in screen.
Alt + P: [Explorer] Display the preview panel.
Alt + Page Down: Move down one screen.
Alt + Page Up: Move up one screen.
Alt + Shift + arrow keys: When a group or tile is in focus on the Start menu, move it in the direction specified.
Alt + Spacebar: Open the shortcut menu for the active window.
Alt + Tab: Switch between open apps.
Alt + selection key: [CMD] Begin selection in block mode.
Alt + underlined letter: Perform the command for that letter; [Dialog Box] Perform the command (or select the option) that is used with that letter.
Alt + ←: Go back; [Explorer] View the previous folder.
Alt + ↑: [Explorer] View the folder that the folder was in.
Alt + →: Go forward; [Explorer] View the next folder.
Arrow keys: [CMD] Move the cursor in the direction specified; [Dialog Box] Select a button if the active option is a group of option buttons.
Backspace: [Dialog Box] Open a folder one level up if a folder is selected in the Save As or Open dialog box; [Explorer] View the previous folder; [Settings] Go back to the settings home page.
Ctrl + A: Select all items in a document or window.
Ctrl + Alt + Tab: Use the arrow keys to switch between all open apps.
Ctrl + C (or Ctrl + Insert): Copy the selected item.
Ctrl + D (or Delete): Delete the selected item and move it to the Recycle Bin.
Ctrl + E: [Explorer] Select the search box.
Ctrl + End (History navigation): [CMD] If the command line is empty, move the viewport to the command line. Otherwise, delete all the characters to the right of the cursor in the command line.
Ctrl + End (Mark mode): [CMD] Move the cursor to the end of the buffer.
Ctrl + Esc: Open Start.
Ctrl + F4: Close the active document (in apps that are full-screen and let you have multiple documents open at the same time).
Ctrl + F: [Explorer] Select the search box.
Ctrl + Home (History navigation): [CMD] If the command line is empty, move the viewport to the top of the buffer. Otherwise, delete all the characters to the left of the cursor in the command line.
Ctrl + Home (Mark mode): [CMD] Move the cursor to the beginning of the buffer.
Ctrl + M: [CMD] Enter Mark mode.
Ctrl + N: [Explorer] Open a new window.
Ctrl + R (or F5): Refresh the active window.
Ctrl + Shift + E: [Explorer] Display all folders above the selected folder.
Ctrl + Shift + Esc: Open Task Manager.
Ctrl + Shift + N: [Explorer] Create a new folder.
Ctrl + Shift + Tab: [Dialog Box] Move back through tabs.
Ctrl + Shift + arrow keys: When a tile is in focus on the Start menu, move it into another tile to create a folder.
Ctrl + Shift + click a taskbar button: [Taskbar] Open an app as an administrator.
Ctrl + Shift with an arrow key: Select a block of text.
Ctrl + Shift: Switch the keyboard layout when multiple keyboard layouts are available.
Ctrl + Spacebar: Turn the Chinese input method editor (IME) on or off.
Ctrl + Tab: [Dialog Box] Move forward through tabs.
Ctrl + V (or Shift + Insert): Paste the selected item.
Ctrl + W: [Explorer] Close the active window.
Ctrl + X: Cut the selected item.
Ctrl + Y: Redo an action.
Ctrl + Z: Undo an action.
Ctrl + arrow key (to move to an item) + Spacebar: Select multiple individual items in a window or on the desktop.
Ctrl + arrow keys: Resize the Start menu when it's open.
Ctrl + click a grouped taskbar button: [Taskbar] Cycle through the windows of the group.
Ctrl + mouse scroll wheel: [Explorer] Change the size and appearance of file and folder icons.
Ctrl + number (number 1–9): [Dialog Box] Move to nth tab.
Ctrl + ←: Move the cursor to the beginning of the previous word.
Ctrl + ↑: Move the cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph; [CMD] Move up one line in the output history.
Ctrl + →: Move the cursor to the beginning of the next word.
Ctrl + ↓: Move the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph; [CMD] Move down one line in the output history.
End: [Explorer] Display the bottom of the active window.
Esc: Stop or leave the current task.
F10: Activate the Menu bar in the active app.
F11: [Explorer] Maximize or minimize the active window.
F2: Rename the selected item.
F3: Search for a file or folder in File Explorer.
F4: Display the address bar list in File Explorer.
F4: [Dialog Box] Display the items in the active list.
F5: Refresh the active window.
F6: Cycle through screen elements in a window or on the desktop.
Home: [Explorer] Display the top of the active window.
Num Lock + asterisk (*): [Explorer] Display all subfolders under the selected folder.
Num Lock + minus (-): [Explorer] Collapse the selected folder.
Num Lock + plus (+): [Explorer] Display the contents of the selected folder.
Page down: [CMD] Move the cursor by one page down.
Page up: [CMD] Move the cursor by one page up.
PrtScn: Take a screenshot of your whole screen and copy it to the clipboard.
Shift + Delete: Delete the selected item without moving it to the Recycle Bin first.
Shift + F10: Display the shortcut menu for the selected item.
Shift + Tab: [Dialog Box] Move back through options.
Shift + click a taskbar button: [Taskbar] Open an app or quickly open another instance of an app.
Shift + right-click a grouped taskbar button: [Taskbar] Show the window menu for the group.
Shift + right-click a taskbar button: [Taskbar] Show the window menu for the app.
Shift with any arrow key: Select more than one item in a window or on the desktop, or select text in a document.
Spacebar: [Dialog Box] Select or clear the check box if the active option is a check box.
Tab: [Dialog Box] Move forward through options.
Type on any page with search box: [Settings] Search settings.
Win + A: Open Action center.
Win + Alt + D: Display and hide the date and time on the desktop.
Win + Alt + number: Open the desktop and open the Jump List for the app pinned to the taskbar in the position indicated by the number.
Win + B: Set focus in the notification area.
Win + C: Open Cortana in listening mode.
Win + Ctrl + D: [Virtual Desktop] Add a virtual desktop.
Win + Ctrl + Enter: Turn on Narrator.
Win + Ctrl + F4: [Virtual Desktop] Close the virtual desktop you're using.
Win + Ctrl + F: Search for PCs (if you're on a network).
Win + Ctrl + Q: OpenQuick Assist.
Win + Ctrl + Shift + B: Wake PC from blank or black screen
Win + Ctrl + Shift + number: Open the desktop and open a new instance of the app located at the given position on the taskbar as an administrator.
Win + Ctrl + Spacebar: Change to a previously selected input.
Win + Ctrl + V: Open shoulder taps.
Win + Ctrl + number: Open the desktop and switch to the last active window of the app pinned to the taskbar in the position indicated by the number.
Win + Ctrl + ←: [Virtual Desktop] Switch between virtual desktops you’ve created on the left.
Win + Ctrl + →: [Virtual Desktop] Switch between virtual desktops you’ve created on the right.
Win + D: Display and hide the desktop.
Win + E: Open File Explorer.
Win + F: Open Feedback Hub and take a screenshot.
Win + G: Open Game bar when a game is open.
Win + H: Start dictation.
Win + Home: Minimize all except the active desktop window (restores all windows on second stroke).
Win + I: Open Settings; [Settings] Open settings.
Win + J: Set focus to a Windows tip when one is available.
Win + K: Open the Connect quick action.
Win + L: Lock your PC or switch accounts.
Win + M: Minimize all windows.
Win + O: Lock device orientation.
Win + P: Choose a presentation display mode.
Win + Pause: Display the System Properties dialog box.
Win + Plus (+): Open Magnifier.
Win + R: Open the Run dialog box.
Win + S: Open search.
Win + Shift + C: Open the charms menu.
Win + Shift + M: Restore minimized windows on the desktop.
Win + Shift + S: Take a screenshot of part of your screen.
Win + Shift + V: Cycle through notifications.
Win + Shift + number: Open the desktop and start a new instance of the app pinned to the taskbar in the position indicated by the number.
Win + Shift + ← or →: Move an app or window in the desktop from one monitor to another.
Win + Shift + ↑: Stretch the desktop window to the top and bottom of the screen.
Win + Shift + ↓: Restore/minimize active desktop windows vertically, maintaining width.
Win + Spacebar: Switch input language and keyboard layout.
Win + T: Cycle through apps on the taskbar.
Win + Tab: Open Task view.
Win + Tab: [Virtual Desktop] Open Task view.
Win + U: Open Ease of Access Center.
Win + V: Open the clipboard.
Win + X: Open the Quick Link menu.
Win + Y: Switch input between Windows Mixed Reality and your desktop.
Win + Z: Show the commands available in an app in full-screen mode.
Win + comma (,): Temporarily peek at the desktop.
Win + forward slash (/): Begin IME reconversion.
Win + number: Open the desktop and start the app pinned to the taskbar in the position indicated by the number. If the app is already running, switch to that app.
Win + period (.) or semicolon (;): Open emoji panel.
Win + ←: Maximize the app or desktop window to the left side of the screen.
Win + ↑: Maximize the window.
Win + →: Maximize the app or desktop window to the right side of the screen.
Win + ↓: Remove current app from screen or minimize the desktop window.
Win: Open or close Start.
←: Open the next menu to the left, or close a submenu; [Explorer] Collapse the current selection (if it's expanded), or select the folder that the folder was in.
→: Open the next menu to the right, or open a submenu; [Explorer] Display the current selection (if it's collapsed), or select the first subfolder.
